A. I start from the park, fly straight across the street, and land on the balcony.  
B. I start from the street, fly upward, and stop on the balcony.  
C. I start from the scooter lane in the park, turn left to face the street outside the park, rise to the height of the high-rise building opposite the street, and move forward to reach the current position of the balcony.  
D. I start from the park, move forward, rise, and then move left to reach the balcony.  
E. I start from a high-rise building, fly across the street, and reach the balcony.

The agent starts from a lower position near the park, moves forward and rises to the height of the high-rise building, and then continues moving forward to reach the balcony. This is consistent with the gradual ascent and forward movement observed in the frames.
